The medical missionary work is the pioneer work of the gospel. Work for the sick and suffering tends to remove prejudice against the evangelical work. The hearts of those for whom medical missionary work is done are often, by this means, opened to the truth. By this work wealthy people may be reached, who with their means will assist in the work. This has been demonstrated in Australia.--Letter 103, 1904, pp. 4, 5. (To "Dear Brother Craw," February 24, 1904.) 

Released March 3, 1970.
